definition[0]: to go around searching for food or other supplies
example[0]: In the summer, the goats forage freely  (=in any place they want to go).
example[1]: People are being forced to forage for food and fuel.
definition[1]: to search for something with your hands in a bag, drawer etc
example[2]: She foraged around in her purse and produced her ticket.
definition[2]: food supplies for horses and cattle
definition[3]: an act of searching for something
